title: Marie Colvin: Eye Patch in the War Zone
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Marie Colvin: Eye Patch in the War Zone.

hook.text: Marie Colvin lost an eye to a grenade in Sri Lanka. She went back to cover more wars wearing an eye patch.

buildup.text: Colvin reported from Chechnya, Kosovo, Sierra Leone, Iraq, and Libya for The Sunday Times.

discovery.text: She believed journalists had a moral duty to bear witness â€” to be present where suffering was happening.

twist.text: In 2012, she was killed by a Syrian government rocket attack that deliberately targeted the press center.

climax.text: Her final broadcast, hours before her death, described children dying in Homs â€” forcing the world to notice.

punchline.text: She died doing what she believed: making the invisible visible.
